title: The complete chloroplast genome of Armand pine Pinus armandii, an endemic conifer tree species to China
abstract: The complete chloroplast genome (cpDNA) sequence of an endemic conifer species, Armand pine Pinus armandii Franch., is determined in this study. The cpDNA was 117,265 bp in length, containing a pair of 475 bp inverted repeat (IR) regions those distinguished in large and small single copy (LSC and SSC) regions of 64,548 and 51,767 bp in length, respectively. The cpDNA contained 114 genes, including 74 protein-coding genes (74 PCG species), 4 ribosomal RNA genes (four rRNA species) and 36 transfer RNA genes (33 tRNA species). Out of these genes, 12 harbor a single intron and most of the genes occurred in a single copy. The overall AT content of the Armand pine cpDNA was 61.2%, while the corresponding values of the LSC, SSC and IR regions were 62.0%, 60.2% and 62.7%, respectively. A phylogenetic analysis revealed that P. armandii chloroplast genome is closely related to that of the P. koraiensis within the genus Pinus.

motivations: The chloroplast genome of Armand pine (Pinus armandii) has not been fully sequenced and analyzed, limiting our understanding of its genetic characteristics.
objectives: Determine the complete chloroplast genome sequence of Armand pine (Pinus armandii).
Analyze the structure, gene content, and phylogenetic relationships of the Armand pine chloroplast genome.
methods: Sequence the complete chloroplast genome of Armand pine using molecular biology techniques.
Analyze the genome structure, gene content, and AT content of the chloroplast genome.
Perform phylogenetic analysis to determine the relationships between Armand pine and other Pinus species.
results: The complete chloroplast genome sequence of Armand pine is 117,265 bp in length, containing 114 genes.
Phylogenetic analysis reveals a close relationship between Armand pine and P. koraiensis within the genus Pinus.

objectives: Determine the complete chloroplast genome sequence of the Armand pine.
methods: Sequence the complete chloroplast genome of the Armand pine, including its large and small single copy regions and inverted repeat regions.

results: The complete chloroplast genome of the Armand pine was sequenced and found to be 117,265 bp in length.
The genome contained 114 genes, including 74 protein-coding genes, 4 ribosomal RNA genes, and 36 transfer RNA genes.

motivations: The complete chloroplast genome sequence of Armand pine, an endemic conifer species to China, had not been previously determined.

Analyze the phylogenetic relationships of P. armandii within the genus Pinus.
